channel.title: Items on my server, not my client?
channel.description: ok i go in my server source and i go in item cfg i search dragon claws and i get the code, (its 9005) so i do ::item 9005 1 and i get null. how do i make it so i see the claws? and this happens for others too

item.source: Items on my server, not my client?

item.title: Items on my server, not my client?
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

It Seems Like You Don’t Have The Models For It… Ill Help You K?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 07, 2009, 05:56:38 pm[/size][hr]This Isn’t Going To Be The Real Ones, But Close Enough.

Okay, Go To Your Client Folder Find Class8.java And Search

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

After That Go To The End Of That Line And Hit Enter And Paste This Code

	if(i == 15000) //ID
		{
			class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
			class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
			class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws"; //Name
			class8.aByteArray178 = "A nice pair of dragon claws.".getBytes(); //Description
			class8.anIntArray156 = new int[4];
			class8.anIntArray160 = new int[4];
			class8.anIntArray156[0] = 24;
			class8.anIntArray156[1] = 33;
			class8.anIntArray156[2] = 41;
			class8.anIntArray156[3] = 49;
			class8.anIntArray160[0] = 924;
			class8.anIntArray160[1] = 924;
			class8.anIntArray160[2] = 924;
			class8.anIntArray160[3] = 924;
			class8.anInt174 = 3781;
			class8.anInt181 = 630;
			class8.anInt190 = 268;
			class8.anInt198 = 1340;
			class8.anInt204 = 0;
			class8.anInt169 = -7;
			class8.anInt194 = -13;
			class8.anInt165 = 3780;
			class8.anInt200 = 3780;
			class8.anInt188 = -1;
			class8.anInt164 = -1;
			class8.anInt175 = -1;
			class8.anInt197 = -1;
		}

Thats The Model, Its Id Is 15000. Now Go To Item.cfg(In Your Source)
And Put This Code At The Bottom.

item = 15000	Dragon_Claws	Omg	15000000	15000000	15000000	0	0	0	0	0	40	39	32	53	25	60	0

Now You Have To Go To Client.java And Find This

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 3101)

Copy And Paste The Whole Thing So That There’s 2 Of The Same Code
It Should Look Like This

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 3101) // Rune claws
{
return 451;
}
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 3101) // Rune claws
{
return 451;
}

Now Just Change The Last ID (3101) To (15000) And The // Rune claws to // Dragon Claws
Like So,

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 3101) // Rune claws
{
return 451;
}
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 15000) // Dragon Claws
{
return 451;
}

Then Search 3101 From Where Your Last Search Took Place You Should Find This…

		if (ItemID == 3101) {
		return 40;
}

Do The Same Thing As The Last Code And Change 3101 To 15000 So It Looks Like This

		if (ItemID == 3101) {
		return 40;
}
		if (ItemID == 15000) {
		return 40;
}

Now, Just Compile The Server & Client And You Are All Done!

~ Tim[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 07, 2009, 06:07:06 pm[/size][hr]Tell Me If That Works?

Read full topic
